manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Shadow and Bone Six of Crows Demon in the Wood The Language of Thorns Enter the Grishaverse! You can read any one of these books first . . . Start with the epic story of Alina Starkov, the Sun Summoner prophesied to save the world in the Shadow and Bone trilogy. Begin with a thrilling heist led by Kaz Brekker and his crew of thieves in the Six of Crows duology. Where did the Darkling's story begin? Meet a misunderstood boy with an extraordinary power in this graphic novel prequel. Discover the tales of a forgotten soldier, a too-clever fox, a town of missing girls, and more in this lavishly illustrated short-story collection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Loved the Series...
reviews.reviewText: I have to say, I was nervous to read these at first because this isn't my typical genre of books, But these were amazing to me. I read all three books in 3 days (I didn't want to put them down!) then the other 2 in the series (Six of Crows and Crooked Kingdom) right after.Shadow and Bone.... I think what was good for me was to see the Netflix show first. I didn't watch the entire series, but it gave me enough to better visualize the Characters in the book. I loved them all... I thought they each brought something to the story. I am very much a Villian fan, so The Darkling was my absolute favorite. I couldn't help but fall in love with his character.I would highly recommend these books to those that like the Fantasy Genre with out alot of mushy romance stuff getting in the way.This is about Hope, Betrayal, Friendship and the love of Ravka....Must Read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good books
reviews.reviewText: My grown daughter and teen grand daughter were reading these and I got them too. I really enjoyed them.My grand daughter said two of the pages in one of the books were so light that it faded to unreadable. I did notice one page in my book was much lighter but still readable. They need some quality control. But Amazon will replace it if you ask them too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great book series - love being able to buy the entire series at once.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Has a permanent Netflix sticker, but overall good books
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed these books! Some pages of the third were a bit faded and had weird markings, but overall they were good quality.However, I HATED that they came with the permanent Netflix sticker — absolutely loathed that it was on every single cover. I ended up painting over it and sealing it with uv resin, but the disruption of the cover art was infuriating. Afterward, I found cover stickers on Etsy, so I recommend using those! They make them specifically to match the book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely loved these books! I’m not normally a fan of YA books but I loved these and the show is perfection also and I highly recommend both!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this boxed set...
reviews.reviewText: After watching the second season of the Netflix TV Show, I broke down and bought a book or two for the first time in a very long time. So first, I will talk about the set itself and hopefully, come back on to review each individual book once I finish it. I was so excited to get this set of books! I love each books' cover design. And it came with a handy sleeve to keep them all in. Now, I just finished the first book today and started the second. I was surprised by how close the show stayed in-line with the first book, Shadow and Bone. I guess we will see with the other two.So, here is a review of the first book: When reading a book, I can usually come up with my own picture in my mind of the characters, settings, and events of said book. I couldn't really do that with this. I was too busy always comparing it to the show that came out last year (which I love). That is why I like to read the book before I see a movie or show. I love to compare the two. And I got to say, spot on so far! Now I can't wait to finish the next book and possibly get the accompanying books that the show was based on- The Six of Crows Duology and The King of Scars.Editing my review to add on that I finished book 2, Siege and Storm, and book 3, Ruin and Rising. I finished them last week but didn't want to leave the world behind and read something else, so I just started the first one again a few days ago. I am again done with the first and started on the second.So, here are my reviews for the next two books...Siege and Storm- Oh, started off with a ton of action and adventure but for me it did get a little boring in the middle and picked up again towards the end. If you are a big fan of the show, I would probably not read this series. I don't want to give away any spoilers for either one, but prepare yourself if you have already seen the show and wanted to read the books.Ruin and Rising- I loved this one! This one was by far my favorite. There were very few parts that I did not like. It kept me engaged until the very last page!!!! Again prepare yourself, if you love the show.Anyway, this would be a total recommendation from me. Go and get these books! Now!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very different from the Netflix series
reviews.reviewText: I read the entire trilogy in 3 days! I’d seen the Netflix series, which is completely different from the books.The story is in the first person, and told from Alina’s POV. The Crows are nowhere in the story (I imagine the Crow duology was blended into the Netflix version in order to introduce us to characters they planned to follow in the cancelled Six of Crows series).I’m waiting on the duology to be delivered today so I can fly through that!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great storytelling, wished the Netflix series was more accurate to the books
Omg I love the book so much, the packaging is also amazing Ty Amazon ❤️
En lo físico, es un hermoso trío de libros. Lo malo es que la etiqueta de Netflix es impresa y no se puede retirar.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Great books, better than the Netflix show
reviews.reviewText: I have to say I really enjoyed these books. The Netflix show really ruined them, so I'm glad they cancelled it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Very shiny letters compared to the single books that are sold. But cool casing!
